channel.title: Alex Wilson's writing
channel.description: Alex on engineering, products & everything in-between

item.title: Weeknotes: Spiriting ‚Äî Week 52, 2024
item.description: Oh gosh OK there‚Äôs quite a lot to get through. One of my most received message all week was, ‚ÄúDid you do KFC for Christmas?‚Äù. Let‚Äôs cut straight to the chase so you can close this tab and get back to doomscrolling: the‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• Oh gosh OK there‚Äôs quite a lot to get through.

  • One of my most received message all week was, ‚ÄúDid you do KFC for Christmas?‚Äù. Let‚Äôs cut straight to the chase so you can close this tab and get back to doomscrolling: the answer is no. I considered getting the ‚ÄúParty Barrel‚Äù but ‚Äî for the price it seemed like horrible value (as well as a lot of food) so I let it sell out. Instead I picked up some Family Mart & Lawson fried chicken on the day, since they were still discounted but could come in much smaller servings and I had that instead. It was OK, and the roast chicken was borderline good (and not on KFC‚Äôs menu) but the fried chicken is - just that - fried chicken. Picture in the little collage at the bottom.

  • This week in data:

    • üéµ Number of times WHAM!'d: 13 Last Christmasses
    • üéÑ Christmas trees observed: 12 trees
    • üéÖ Occurrences of the word "Christmas" in this article: 10

  • For lack of any carols I pulled up the Salvation Army‚Äôs yearly shindig on the BBC Sounds app. I tried to listen to King‚Äôs College Chapel service about some number of carols and lessons ‚Äî but it‚Äôs locked-up, gated and paywalled in so many ways outside of the UK that calling it a religious ceremony seems slightly inaccurate? First year without hearing ‚ÄúOnce in Royal David's City‚Äù. :^(

    ‚Ä¶

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Triangulating ‚Äî Week 51, 2024
item.description: Spent a bit of this week debugging an infrastructure problem in an unfamiliar stack, and I‚Äôm really enjoying this period of discovery. Finding the problem was super affirming. Did a little intro in the engineering all‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• Spent a bit of this week debugging an infrastructure problem in an unfamiliar stack, and I‚Äôm really enjoying this period of discovery. Finding the problem was super affirming.
  • Did a little intro in the engineering all-hands. It‚Äôs hard to distill yourself into a slide but I think I got away with it. (it had pictures and I got distracted mid-sentence by the chat trying to identify one!)
  • Closed the week with the really big yearly all-hands. My head is still spinning!
  • Met up with JK & FT for dinner in a wine bar in Shimbashi to reminisce, and learned more about how all these visas work in the process. Also walked away slightly more optimistic about learning the language.
  • The 21st was the winter solstice, and marking the occasion I went to the incredibly packed H≈çj≈çji in Waseda to pick up a Ichiyo Raifuku.
  • It needs attaching to the wall, facing the right direction at exactly midnight. Unfortunately I didn‚Äôt have a surface facing the right direction, so instead it is now sitting on a‚Ä¶

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Verifying ‚Äî Week 50, 2024
item.description: Over the course of this week I made a few small break-throughs culminating in the realisation that: If after one week I suspected that cleaning, sorting and separating garbage was about to become a big part of my life‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• Over the course of this week I made a few small break-throughs culminating in the realisation that: If after one week I suspected that cleaning, sorting and separating garbage was about to become a big part of my life - Now after three I know the remainder will become all about points.

  • This week in data:

    • ü§ë PayPay points earned: 1215pts
    • üçã Vitamin C consumed: 3690mg
    • üè¨ Second-hand stores searched: 7

  • Before I left I asked around a bit, ‚ÄúIf I‚Äôm bringing a souvenir/gift from our culture what should it be?‚Äù The answers were many, but a consensus formed split somewhere between M&S Shortbread (you know, the blue tin? yes that blue tin. You know.) and tea. Shortbread seemed more practical. Anyway I brought it in this week and it went down a treat.

  • Finally booked into some language lessons, starting in January... I'm excited!

  • One big change this week is that after a lot (and I mean a lot) of wrangling, my Apple account is now a Japanese one. Meaning that at the cost of losing access to a few apps, I now have access to some incredibly useful ones: Such as PayPay.

    ‚Ä¶

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Orienting ‚Äî Week 49, 2024
item.description: This week felt considerably more normal than last week. Maybe the routine got me somewhere. Maybe it‚Äôs just the jet lag having worn off. Maybe it‚Äôs the nature of the life-admin changing. Maybe it‚Äôs something else‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• This week felt considerably more normal than last week. Maybe the routine got me somewhere. Maybe it‚Äôs just the jet lag having worn off. Maybe it‚Äôs the nature of the life-admin changing. Maybe it‚Äôs something else entirely.

  • This week in data:

    • üìº Training videos watched: 5 hours
    • üåØ Team lunches: 3
    • üçµ Oi Ocha consumed: 3.5 litres

  • Felt my first earthquake in yonks on Tuesday evening. It‚Äôs been a while (maybe 5 years?) so I‚Äôd forgotten how it feels. Intensity 1 so nobody else was even remotely fussed.

  • This was my first week at work, and I‚Äôm feeling the same sense of awe and wonder one does exploring any new world. I‚Äôm pretty excited!

  • Part of onboarding, or, I guess, being in a large company is needing an evergreen way of introducing yourself - and so one of my tasks involved writing a page about myself for an internal documentation hub. (It also includes a link to the about me page on this blog, which, is somewhat out of date - sorry!) It‚Äôs kind-of great, and reading others I realised that there‚Äôs lots to strike up conversations about.

    ‚Ä¶

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Not Unpacking ‚Äî Week 48, 2024
item.description: This was one of these weird weeks where I didn‚Äôt have much on - because it was my time off between two jobs. It was a bit like a staycation? But in a new place? Lots of life-admin. Where did I leave you? Ah yes‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• This was one of these weird weeks where I didn‚Äôt have much on - because it was my time off between two jobs. It was a bit like a staycation? But in a new place? Lots of life-admin.

  • Where did I leave you? Ah yes, watching Garfield on the plane. Tray table went up, we landed, we taxied and we disembarked. Now for the moment I was dreading: I went to the immigration counter for residents and was presented with my very own residence card. Phew - that was easy. And then both it and my passport were taken from me and I was asked to take a seat and wait. Uh-oh. After what felt like an eternity (a few minutes) both were handed back and I was allowed through: I‚Äôd given the wrong post-code.

  • Collected my bags, and met an agent who handed me my SIM card, keys, and a few other bits I‚Äôd need, before escorting me to a taxi. On the way I plug in my new SIM card on the way, message a few people to let them know I‚Äôve landed. Before I knew it, we‚Äôve arrived and I‚Äôm standing alone on a brand new street with two suitcases, a backpack and some documents to keep me company. And I now understand the confusion at border control: There's no building by the name I've been given.

    ‚Ä¶

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Not Packing ‚Äî Week 47, 2024
item.description: This was my last week at the FT, something I kept very close to my chest. It surprised a few people. Truth be told it didn‚Äôt really sink in for me until this week. I spent the entire week trying to remain composed‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• This was my last week at the FT, something I kept very close to my chest. It surprised a few people. Truth be told it didn‚Äôt really sink in for me until this week. I spent the entire week trying to remain composed.

  • Why leave? The exit survey poses that question expectantly. It‚Äôs simple: I‚Äôm relocating and circumstances [editor‚Äôs note: including but not only my age] made now the right time. Where to? Tokyo. I‚Äôve wanted to do it since 2017, so, you know. That‚Äôs why. This has been in the works for a hot minute.

  • This week in data:

    • ü•™ Pret eaten: 7 sandwiches
    • üö∂ People who said they plan to visit Japan next year: 12
    • üé¨ Movies watched: 6 films

  • Between packing and leaving a job. I began the week with a todo list as long as my arm...

  • Many people reached out to chat. Some wished me luck. Some said kind things. All of them ‚Äî some of whom might be reading this ‚Äî in reaching out made leaving just that little bit harder. Thank-you? But, really.

  • The most common question I got was ‚ÄúDo you speak any japanese?‚Äù to which I answered ‚ÄúÂ∞ë„ÅóË©±„Åõ„Åæ„Åô‚Äù, or, a little. The second most common question was ‚ÄúAre you packed yet?‚Äù to which I answered ‚ÄúNo, but that‚Äôs not the problem - it‚Äôs getting rid of my furniture and all the other things I‚Äôm not packing!‚Äù...

    ‚Ä¶

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Red Arrow ‚Äî Week 46, 2024
item.description: Hello from sunny Birmingham. The weather has been alternating between rain and grey all weekend. This week in data: Magazines issues thrown into a recycling bin: 37 Heartfelt emails sent: 9 Spent some time steeling‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• Hello from sunny Birmingham. The weather has been alternating between rain and grey all weekend.
  • This week in data:
    • Magazines issues thrown into a recycling bin: 37
    • Heartfelt emails sent: 9
  • Spent some time steeling myself for a few conversations that I thought would be difficult. No, reader, they all went swimmingly well. I‚Äôm genuinely pleasantly surprised.
  • I got here in a van: Despite having multiple train lines from Birmingham to London, it‚Äôs somehow still quicker to drive from my flat in London to my parents home in Birmingham. Or at least, it should have been: It took nearly 30 minutes to drive down Putney High Street alone. Sheesh.
  • Bluesky is really popping off huh.
  • L helped me with some more chores. Later we played some music, first semi-seriously and later after giving up just committed some crimes with my apparently now broken mixer.
  • Despite the (painful, at least to me) mistakes that was still a pretty technically advanced set and I'm pretty proud of how far I've come since picking DJing back up in 2020. It's such a fun hobby. And it's a very different, really intimate ‚Äî and almost therapeutic‚Ä¶

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Thirty Hours ‚Äî Week 45, 2024
item.description: Much of my week was spent with the US elections, making sure that reporting worked as well as it could. Looking after the systems and tools telling the news makes it easier to detach from the news. However it isn‚Äôt‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• Much of my week was spent with the US elections, making sure that reporting worked as well as it could. Looking after the systems and tools telling the news makes it easier to detach from the news. However it isn‚Äôt always easy to stay detached: That‚Äôs the rub.

  • This week in data:

    • üß¶ Sponsored socks worn: 3 pairs.
    • üçñ Meat consumed: 0 grams.
    • üìß Emails deleted: 6251 threads.

  • Bluesky is now my primary social media network. If you don‚Äôt already, give me a follow!

  • Coverage of the US election took up the entirety of the first few days of the week, with Tuesday and Wednesday turning into something of an all-nighter. We were prepared for a several-day marathon, but it quickly became clear that this was much shorter (yet faster) sprint instead.

  • It all went rather smoothly. We got some delightful feedback from some readers ‚Äî and several million page-views in the first day. That‚Äôs the upside, or, a ‚Äúreason to be cheerful‚Äù as GC would put it.

  • A lot can change in thirty hours: There's now a lot of commentary floating around, and with the exception of a few interesting anecdotes such as The Bronx being the biggest swing, I'm mostly blocking it out. Especially the hit-pieces rushing to apportion some blame. Mostly those, actually. It isn't that I'm apolitical ‚Äî I am not ‚Äî or even that I want this blog to be: I am just still processing, as I'm sure many others are too.

    ‚Ä¶

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Plant-Based Nuggets ‚Äî Week 44, 2024
item.description: Spent a lot of the week helping with various aspects of US election coverage next week. Some assorted tasks and a real deep-dive into web performance and maps, the latter which I‚Äôve not done much work with before‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• Spent a lot of the week helping with various aspects of US election coverage next week. Some assorted tasks and a real deep-dive into web performance and maps, the latter which I‚Äôve not done much work with before. Managed to get a 75% performance improvement in a crucial area which I‚Äôm quite happy with.
  • This week in numbers:
    • Ebay listings created: 2
    • Red-meat consumed: 0 grams
    • Headphones thrown away: 1.5 pairs
  • Starting to like React Hooks. Yeah, I‚Äôve not been thrilled at them until now.
  • LF and I went to Baron‚Äôs Bites, which was a League of Legends pop-up/takeover of Butchies. Was it worth the twenty-minute queue? No. But I got a badge, which I gave away later that same evening. I paid ¬£11 for their finest plant-based nuggets which started out strong and ended in regret. The queue seemed friendly.
  • The Apple Intelligence update dropped. Um. It‚Äôs not great, is it? Here‚Äôs a doozy: ‚ÄúCow sighting; desperate for cow manure‚Äù. Here‚Äôs another: ‚ÄúOne soup through a straw, deemed‚Ä¶

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Restoring ‚Äî Week 43, 2024
item.description: Low energy start to the week: I had Monday off, and ended up taking part of Tuesday off too. I‚Äôve been feeling a little under the weather, but I think now slowly on the mend. This week in data: Individual shoes thrown‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• Low energy start to the week: I had Monday off, and ended up taking part of Tuesday off too. I‚Äôve been feeling a little under the weather, but I think now slowly on the mend.

  • This week in data:

    • Individual shoes thrown away: 5
    • How long it took me to realise the clocks went back: 18 hours
    • Total of all payments made in cash: ¬£17

  • I have glasses now, sort-of. I can see totally fine without them - but over the years I‚Äôve developed an astigmatism and so they‚Äôre really helping with situations with contrasting bright lights. Still figuring out when to wear them.

  • In very exciting work news, CCC ‚Äî which I‚Äôve here and there since its kick-off last April ‚Äî is now finally live, debuted this week by Joanna Kao‚Äôs excellent article on AI-assisted accessibility tooling, and how they aren‚Äôt what they seem. It was a monumental effort getting there and the change seems subtle, but is profound: Previously an article with inline functionality like that would not work on the main website or app. The same is true of most news organisations and so I'm very excited to see where this capability goes!

    ‚Ä¶

Read the full post here...
